game_plan.overview: Brick Breaker is a classic arcade game where players control a paddle to bounce a ball and break a layer of bricks. The objective is to destroy all the bricks while preventing the ball from falling off the screen.
game_plan.mechanics: Players control a paddle to bounce a ball, breaking bricks as the ball strikes them. The game includes a pause feature and an exit option.

file.name: main.py
file.description: This is the entry point of the game, initializing Pygame, creating an instance of the Game class, and managing the game loop execution. The main loop checks for quit events and calls the game state update and render methods.

file.name: game.py
file.description: This file contains the Game class which handles the overall game state and logic, initializes game entities, and processes user inputs. It manages the main game loop, toggling pause state, and ensuring smooth transitions between game states.

file.name: paddle.py
file.description: The Paddle class represents the player's paddle. It handles paddle movements based on user input and manages its drawing on the game surface.

file.name: ball.py
file.description: This file contains the Ball class, responsible for the ball's movement, bouncing behavior, and collision detection with the paddle and bricks. It also handles rendering the ball on the game surface.

file.name: brick.py
file.description: This file contains the Brick class, representing the bricks in the game. It manages brick initialization, drawing, and behavior when hit by the ball.
